title: Microsoft Office 2016 VL Multi-Language Interface Pack (x86/x64)
description:
Microsoft Office 2016 VL Multi-Language Interface Pack DVD (x86/x64)

About this release

- Release: official MSDN ISO image
- Version: 16.0.4266.1001
- Requirements: Office 2016 Volume License editions
- These packs are NOT compatible with Office 2016 Click-to-Run/Office 365
- Includes: 51 Language Interface Packs (32-bit / 64-bit)

About Language Interface Packs

You can install language interface packs after installing Microsoft Office 2016 Volume License.

Features of Language Interface Packs (LIPs)

Language Interface Packs can be used to add more language options to Office without changing the current default language of your Office installation.
Language interface packs change the language for the ribbon and commands for some Office applications, and include a spell checker for their language.

This compilation includes LIPs for the following languages:

Afrikaans, Amharic, Assamese, Azerbaijani (Latin), Belarusian, Bangla (Bangladesh), Bangla (Bengali India), Bosnian (Latin), Catalan, Valencian, Welsh, Basque, Persian, Filipino, Irish, Scottish, Galician, Gujarati, Armenian, Icelandic, Georgian, Khmer, Kannada, Konkani, Kyrgyz, Luxembourgish, Maori, Macedonian, Malayalam, Mongolian, Marathi, Maltese, Nepali, Norwegian Nynorsk, Odia, Punjabi, Dari, Quechua (Peru), Sindhi (Arabic), Sinhala, Albanian, Serbian (Cyrillic, Bosnia and Herzegovina), Serbian (Cyrillic, Serbia), Kiswahili, Tamil, Telugu, Turkmen, Tatar, Uyghur, Urdu, Uzbek (Latin)

Installation

Mount / burn / extract ISO and install the desired Language Pack(s)

Configure Office language

After you install the language accessory pack, you must configure Office for your new language preferences.

- Open any Office program and then click File > Options > Language.
- Under Choose Editing Languages, make sure that the language you want to use is added to this list.
- If the language accessory pack includes proofing tools for that language, the Proofing column shows Installed.
- Under Choose Display and Help languages, you can change the default display and help languages for all your Office applications.
- Restart all Office programs for your changes to take effect.
- You can change the default language for all your Office applications in the Set the Office Language Preferences dialog.

Checksums

CRC32: 210F4DB4
MD5: EDBEC6AC66DB002B8BFE2ADF5E56B4AB
SHA-1: 5CBCD3277A603C774D7E4F1689AF48C7D159723D

Please SEED for a while!
